        <tr>
          <td>
<div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable 
preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the 
issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: 
elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other 
disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.</p>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br><br><br> -Publisher 
FASB<br><br><br><br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br><br><br> 
-Topic 310<br><br><br><br> -SubTopic 10<br><br><br><br> -Section 
S99<br><br><br><br> -Paragraph 2<br><br><br><br> -Subparagraph (SAB TOPIC 
4.E)<br><br><br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=27010918&amp;loc=d3e74512-
122707<br><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>Reference 2: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br><br><br> -Publisher 
SEC<br><br><br><br> -Name Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB)<br><br><br><br>
-Number Topic 4<br><br><br><br> -Section 
E<br><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>Reference 3: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br><br><br> -Publisher 
FASB<br><br><br><br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br><br><br> 
-Topic 210<br><br><br><br> -SubTopic 10<br><br><br><br> -Section 
S99<br><br><br><br> -Paragraph 1<br><br><br><br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.29-

http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-

              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);"

                  <tr>

              </div>

FlagID="0"><Id>2</Id><IsAbstractGroupTitle>false</IsAbstractGroupTitle><LabelSep
arator>
</LabelSeparator><Level>2</Level><ElementName>STTH_SaleOfCanadianEnergyServicesB
usinessTextBlock</ElementName><ElementPrefix>STTH_</ElementPrefix><IsBaseElement

ype><IsReportTitle>false</IsReportTitle><IsSegmentTitle>false</IsSegmentTitle><I
sCalendarTitle>false</IsCalendarTitle><IsEquityPrevioslyReportedAsRow>false</IsE

<IsBeginningBalance>false</IsBeginningBalance><IsEndingBalance>false</IsEndingBa
lance><IsReverseSign>false</IsReverseSign><FootnoteIndexer /><Cells><Cell 
FlagID="0" ContextID="From2012-01-01to2012-06-30" 
UnitID=""><Id>1</Id><IsNumeric>false</IsNumeric><IsRatio>false</IsRatio><Display
ZeroAsNone>false</DisplayZeroAsNone><NumericAmount>0</NumericAmount><RoundedNume
ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On June 3, 2011, the Company 
entered into a Stock Purchase
Agreement (&amp;#147;SPA&amp;#148;) with a private company to sell the capital 
stock of its Canadian Energy Services subsidiaries, Decca
Consulting, Ltd. and Decca Consulting, Inc. (collectively referred to as 
&amp;#147;Decca&amp;#148;), for a total sales price of $4,600,000
(plus a working capital adjustment).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The sales price 
consisted of the following components: (a) Cash amount of $350,000
paid at closing; (b) Non-interest bearing notes (the &amp;#147;Receivables 
Notes&amp;#148;) issued by the purchaser in the amount of
$2,776,274 (including the working capital adjustment), payable out of the post-
closing collection of Decca&amp;#146;s accounts receivable;
and (c) Interest bearing notes (the &amp;#147;Installment Notes&amp;#148;) 
issued by the purchaser in the amount of $1,850,000, payable
in 48 monthly installments of principal and interest, at 8% per annum, 
commencing on October 1, 2011. The Company recognized a
pre-tax gain from this sale in the year ended December 31, 2011 in the amount of
$2,695,100.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;Subsequent to the sale, the purchaser made periodic payments
to the Company on the Receivables Notes in the aggregate amount of $2,776,274 
through March 2012, at which time, the notes had
been fully paid (including the working capital adjustment).&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;With 
regard to the Installment Notes in the aggregate amount
of $1,850,000, the purchaser did not make monthly payments on the notes 
beginning in October 2011, in accordance with the stated
terms.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In April 2012, the Company and the purchaser reached 
an informal agreement whereby the purchaser began making
the stated monthly note payments under a delayed payment 
plan.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Such monthly payments continued through December 2012,
at which time, the purchaser informed the Company that it would defer making
further monthly payments on the Installment Notes,
pending resolution of certain indemnity provisions in the 
SPA.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At that time, the outstanding balance of principal and
accrued interest on the Installment Notes was $1,660,902.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In 
February 2013, the dispute between the parties regarding
the Installment Notes was referred to binding arbitration as permitted under the
SPA.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In June 2013, the Company and
the purchaser reached a preliminary agreement to settle the outstanding balance 
of the Installment Notes effectively terminating
the arbitration proceedings.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The terms of the preliminary 
settlement agreement are confidential, however, it is intended
that a one-time cash payment will be made by the purchaser to the Company and 
that the purchaser will assume all of the Company&amp;#146;s
remaining obligations, including any continent liabilities, related to its prior
ownership of Decca.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s
acceptance of the preliminary settlement on the Installment Notes has resulted 
in a total pre-tax net loss to the Company in the
amount of $536,235.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company had previously recognized an 
estimated loss provision in the fourth quarter of 2012
in the amount of $250,000, therefore, an additional loss provision was 
recognized in the second quarter of 2013 in the amount of
$286,235.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The closing of the definitive settlement is 
expected to occur in the third quarter of 
2013.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer /><CurrencyCode 
/><CurrencySymbol 
/><IsIndependantCurrency>false</IsIndependantCurrency><ShowCurrencySymbol>false<

DataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monetary</Simpl
eDataType><ElementDefenition>The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of 
the current portion of long-term obligations drawn from a line of credit, which 
is a bank's commitment to make loans up to a specific amount. Examples of items 
that might be included in the application of this element may consist of letters
of credit, standby letters of credit, and revolving credit arrangements, under 
which borrowings can be made up to a maximum amount as of any point in time 
conditional on satisfaction of specified terms before, as of and after the date 
of drawdowns on the line. Includes short-term obligations that would normally be
classified as current liabilities but for which (a) postbalance sheet date 
issuance of a long term obligation to refinance the short term obligation on a 
long term basis, or (b) the enterprise has entered into a financing agreement 
that clearly permits the enterprise to refinance the short-term obligation on a 
long term basis and the following conditions are met (1) the agreement does not 
expire within 1 year and is not cancelable by the lender except for violation of
an objectively determinable provision, (2) no violation exists at the BS date, 
and (3) the lender has entered into the financing agreement is expected to be 
financially capable of honoring the 
agreement.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef

  <body><span style="display: none;">v2.4.0.8</span><table class="report" 
border="0" cellspacing="2" id="ID0ELE">
      <tr>
        <th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2">
          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>8. Contingencies<br></strong></div>
        </th>
        <th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <th class="th">
          <div>Jun. 30, 2013</div>
        </th>
      </tr>
      <tr class="re">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_STTH_ContingenciesAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Contingencies</strong></a></td>
        <td class="text">&#xA0;<span></span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="ro">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock', window );">8. 
Contingencies</a></td>
        <td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0">From time to time the Company may become involved in 
litigation
in the ordinary course of business.&#160;&#160;At the present time, other than 
the Company&#146;s disclosures below, the Company&#146;s
management is not aware of any such litigation or other legal proceedings that 
could have a material adverse effect on its results
of operations, cash flows or financial condition.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Triumph 
Energy, Inc., a subsidiary in the Exploration &#38;
Production segment, and a former subsidiary which was sold in 2008, have been 
named as joint defendants in several lawsuits involving
professional liability and other matters arising in the normal course of 
business in the State of Louisiana.&#160;&#160;Most of
these cases have been settled with little or no net cost to 
Triumph.&#160;&#160;It is not practical at the present time to determine
the amount or likelihood of an unfavorable outcome to the Company&#146;s 
consolidated financial position or results of operations
of any of the remaining actions against Triumph.&#160;&#160;The Company believes
that Triumph has meritorious defenses in each
case and is vigorously defending these matters.&#160;&#160;The Company has 
recorded no provision for estimated losses in these
cases as of June 30, 2013.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In October 
2008, an insurer for the Company&#146;s inactive
Construction Staffing subsidiary filed a lawsuit against the subsidiary alleging
default on a premium finance obligation in the
amount of approximately $200,000, plus interest and attorney&#146;s 
fees.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that its inactive Construction
Staffing subsidiary has a meritorious position in this matter and has not 
engaged legal counsel to defend this case.&#160;&#160;A
default judgment was rendered in favor of the plaintiff in January 2011 and the 
Company has recorded an accrual for the subsidiary&#146;s
estimated loss exposure of approximately $100,000 as of June 30, 2013.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The 
Company, as a lessee and operator of oil and gas properties,
is subject to various federal, state and local laws and regulations relating to 
discharge of materials into, and protection of,
the environment. These laws and regulations may, among other things, impose 
liability on the lessee under an oil and gas lease
for the cost of pollution clean-up resulting from operations and subject the 
lessee to liability for pollution damages. The Company
maintains insurance coverage, which it believes is customary in the industry, 
although the Company is not fully insured against
all environmental risks. The Company is not aware of any environmental claims 
existing as of June 30, 2013, which have not been
provided for, covered by insurance or otherwise have a material impact on its 
financial position or results of operations. There
can be no assurance, however, that current regulatory requirements will not 
change, or past noncompliance with environmental laws
will not be discovered on the Company&#146;s properties.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/115% Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
10pt">&#160;</p><span></span></td>
      </tr>
    </table>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_LinesOfCreditCurrent">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the 
current portion of long-term obligations drawn from a line of credit, which is a
bank's commitment to make loans up to a specific amount. Examples of items that 
might be included in the application of this element may consist of letters of 
credit, standby letters of credit, and revolving credit arrangements, under 
which borrowings can be made up to a maximum amount as of any point in time 
conditional on satisfaction of specified terms before, as of and after the date 
of drawdowns on the line. Includes short-term obligations that would normally be
classified as current liabilities but for which (a) postbalance sheet date 
issuance of a long term obligation to refinance the short term obligation on a 
long term basis, or (b) the enterprise has entered into a financing agreement 
that clearly permits the enterprise to refinance the short-term obligation on a 
long term basis and the following conditions are met (1) the agreement does not 
expire within 1 year and is not cancelable by the lender except for violation of
an objectively determinable provision, (2) no violation exists at the BS date, 
and (3) the lender has entered into the financing agreement is expected to be 
financially capable of honoring the agreement.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1:

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_LongTermDebt">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Carrying amount of long-term debt, net of unamortized 
discount or premium, including current and noncurrent amounts. Includes, but not
limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and 
commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Carrying amount of long-term debt, net of unamortized 
discount or premium, excluding amounts to be repaid within one year or the 
normal operating cycle, if longer (current maturities). Includes, but not
limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and 
commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.</p>

<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>47
<FILENAME>R7.htm
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
<html>
  <head>
    <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=us-ascii">
    <link rel="StyleSheet" type="text/css" href="report.css"><script 
type="text/javascript" src="Show.js">/* Do Not Remove This Comment 
*/</script></head>
  <body><span style="display: none;">v2.4.0.8</span><table class="report" 
border="0" cellspacing="2" id="ID0ELE">
      <tr>
        <th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2">
          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>2. Sale of Canadian Energy Services
Business<br></strong></div>
        </th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <th class="th">
          <div>Jun. 30, 2012</div>
        </th>
      </tr>
      <tr class="re">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_STTH_SaleOfCanadianEnergyServicesBusinessAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Sale Of Canadian Energy Services Business</strong></a></td>
        <td class="text">&#xA0;<span></span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="ro">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_STTH_SaleOfCanadianEnergyServicesBusinessTextBlock', window );">2. Sale 
of Canadian Energy Services Business</a></td>
        <td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0">On June 3, 2011, the Company entered into a Stock Purchase
Agreement (&#147;SPA&#148;) with a private company to sell the capital stock of 
its Canadian Energy Services subsidiaries, Decca
Consulting, Ltd. and Decca Consulting, Inc. (collectively referred to as 
&#147;Decca&#148;), for a total sales price of $4,600,000
(plus a working capital adjustment).&#160;&#160;The sales price consisted of the
following components: (a) Cash amount of $350,000
paid at closing; (b) Non-interest bearing notes (the &#147;Receivables 
Notes&#148;) issued by the purchaser in the amount of
$2,776,274 (including the working capital adjustment), payable out of the post-
closing collection of Decca&#146;s accounts receivable;
and (c) Interest bearing notes (the &#147;Installment Notes&#148;) issued by the
purchaser in the amount of $1,850,000, payable
in 48 monthly installments of principal and interest, at 8% per annum, 
commencing on October 1, 2011. The Company recognized a
pre-tax gain from this sale in the year ended December 31, 2011 in the amount of
$2,695,100.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Subsequent 
to the sale, the purchaser made periodic payments
to the Company on the Receivables Notes in the aggregate amount of $2,776,274 
through March 2012, at which time, the notes had
been fully paid (including the working capital adjustment).</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">With regard
to the Installment Notes in the aggregate amount
of $1,850,000, the purchaser did not make monthly payments on the notes 
beginning in October 2011, in accordance with the stated
terms.&#160;&#160;In April 2012, the Company and the purchaser reached an 
informal agreement whereby the purchaser began making
the stated monthly note payments under a delayed payment plan.&#160;&#160;Such 
monthly payments continued through December 2012,
at which time, the purchaser informed the Company that it would defer making 
further monthly payments on the Installment Notes,
pending resolution of certain indemnity provisions in the SPA.&#160;&#160;At 
that time, the outstanding balance of principal and
accrued interest on the Installment Notes was $1,660,902.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In February
2013, the dispute between the parties regarding
the Installment Notes was referred to binding arbitration as permitted under the
SPA.&#160;&#160;In June 2013, the Company and
the purchaser reached a preliminary agreement to settle the outstanding balance 
of the Installment Notes effectively terminating
the arbitration proceedings.&#160;&#160;The terms of the preliminary settlement 
agreement are confidential, however, it is intended
that a one-time cash payment will be made by the purchaser to the Company and 
that the purchaser will assume all of the Company&#146;s
remaining obligations, including any continent liabilities, related to its prior
ownership of Decca.&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s
acceptance of the preliminary settlement on the Installment Notes has resulted 
in a total pre-tax net loss to the Company in the
amount of $536,235.&#160;&#160;The Company had previously recognized an 
estimated loss provision in the fourth quarter of 2012
in the amount of $250,000, therefore, an additional loss provision was 
recognized in the second quarter of 2013 in the amount of
$286,235.&#160;&#160;The closing of the definitive settlement is expected to 
occur in the third quarter of 2013.</p><span></span></td>
      </tr>
    </table>
    <div style="display: none;">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" 
id="defref_STTH_SaleOfCanadianEnergyServicesBusinessAbstract">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Details</a><div>
                <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Name:</strong></td>

                  </tr>

<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>48
<FILENAME>report.css
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
background-color: #def;
border: 2px solid #2F4497;
font-size: 1em;
position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
display: block;
font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
margin-top: 0px;

gaap_</ElementPrefix><IsBaseElement>true</IsBaseElement><BalanceType>na</Balance

ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;From time to time the Company may 
become involved in litigation
in the ordinary course of business.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At the present time, 
other than the Company&amp;#146;s disclosures below, the Company&amp;#146;s
management is not aware of any such litigation or other legal proceedings that 
could have a material adverse effect on its results
of operations, cash flows or financial condition.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;Triumph Energy, Inc., a subsidiary in the Exploration &amp;#38;
Production segment, and a former subsidiary which was sold in 2008, have been 
named as joint defendants in several lawsuits involving
professional liability and other matters arising in the normal course of 
business in the State of Louisiana.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Most of
these cases have been settled with little or no net cost to 
Triumph.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;It is not practical at the present time to determine
the amount or likelihood of an unfavorable outcome to the Company&amp;#146;s 
consolidated financial position or results of operations
of any of the remaining actions against Triumph.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company 
believes that Triumph has meritorious defenses in each
case and is vigorously defending these matters.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company 
has recorded no provision for estimated losses in these
cases as of June 30, 2013.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In 
October 2008, an insurer for the Company&amp;#146;s inactive
Construction Staffing subsidiary filed a lawsuit against the subsidiary alleging
default on a premium finance obligation in the
amount of approximately $200,000, plus interest and attorney&amp;#146;s 
fees.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company believes that its inactive Construction
Staffing subsidiary has a meritorious position in this matter and has not 
engaged legal counsel to defend this case.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A
default judgment was rendered in favor of the plaintiff in January 2011 and the 
Company has recorded an accrual for the subsidiary&amp;#146;s
estimated loss exposure of approximately $100,000 as of June 30, 2013.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
Company, as a lessee and operator of oil and gas properties,
is subject to various federal, state and local laws and regulations relating to 
discharge of materials into, and protection of,
the environment. These laws and regulations may, among other things, impose 
liability on the lessee under an oil and gas lease
for the cost of pollution clean-up resulting from operations and subject the 
lessee to liability for pollution damages. The Company
maintains insurance coverage, which it believes is customary in the industry, 
although the Company is not fully insured against
all environmental risks. The Company is not aware of any environmental claims 
existing as of June 30, 2013, which have not been
provided for, covered by insurance or otherwise have a material impact on its 
financial position or results of operations. There
can be no assurance, however, that current regulatory requirements will not 
change, or past noncompliance with environmental laws
will not be discovered on the Company&amp;#146;s properties.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt/115% Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>

        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Tabular disclosure of long-debt instruments or arrangements, 
including identification, terms, features, collateral requirements and other 
information necessary to a fair presentation. These are debt arrangements that 
originally required repayment more than twelve months after issuance or greater 
than the normal operating cycle of the entity, if longer.</p>

      <tr>
        <th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2">
          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>Document and Entity

                <p>The end date of the period reflected on the cover page if a 
periodic report. For all other reports and registration statements containing 
historical data, it is the date up through which that historical data is 
presented.  If there is no historical data in the report, use the filing date. 
The format of the date is CCYY-MM-DD.</p>

of registrant's classes of capital or common stock or other ownership interests,
if and as stated on cover of related periodic report. Where multiple classes or 
units exist define each class/interest by adding class of stock items such as 
Common Class A [Member], Common Class B [Member] or Partnership Interest 
[Member] onto the Instrument [Domain] of the Entity Listings, Instrument.</p>

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Indicate "Yes" or "No" whether registrants (1) have filed all
reports required to be filed by Section 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange 
Act of 1934 during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that 
registrants were required to file such reports), and (2) have been subject to 
such filing requirements for the past 90 days. This information should be based 
on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related 
disclosure.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);"

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Indicate whether the registrant is one of the following: (1) 
Large Accelerated Filer, (2) Accelerated Filer, (3) Non-accelerated Filer, (4) 
Smaller Reporting Company (Non-accelerated) or (5) Smaller Reporting Accelerated
Filer. Definitions of these categories are stated in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange 
Act. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent
filing containing the related disclosure.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
